title: Two Minor Leaguers receive suspensions
subtitle: Two Minor Leaguers receive suspensions
body: Two Minor League players were suspended after violating the Minor League Drug Prevention and Treatment Program, the Commissioner's Office announced Tuesday. Free-agent pitcher Michael Hart received a 50-game suspension after testing positive for a drug of abuse a second time. Steven Shell, a free-agent pitcher, also received a 50-game suspension after testing positive for metabolites of Stanozolol. The suspensions for both will begin immediately once they sign with a Major League club. Quinn Roberts is a contributor for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Quinn Roberts
